meanings.sent1: The chiefest task for the day was to finish homework before bedtime.
meanings.sent2: Her chiefest concern was the well-being of her family.
meanings.sent3: The chiefest cookie in the jar mysteriously disappeared overnight.
meanings.sent4: In the forest, the chiefest tree stood tall and proud among the others.
meanings.sent5: The chiefest star in the sky shone brightly on the clear night.

meanings.sent1: The chiefest officer in the army led the troops into battle.
meanings.sent2: The chiefest executive made the final decision for the company.
meanings.sent3: The chiefest cat in the neighborhood ruled over all the other pets.
meanings.sent4: The chiefest judge in the court delivered a fair verdict.
meanings.sent5: The chiefest captain of the ship guided the crew through the storm.

meanings.sent1: The chiefest challenge of the race was the steep hill at the end.
meanings.sent2: Her chiefest fear was speaking in front of a large audience.
meanings.sent3: The chiefest snowstorm of the year blanketed the town in white.
meanings.sent4: The chiefest hunger he had ever felt gnawed at his stomach.
meanings.sent5: The chiefest joy of the party was when the birthday cake was brought out.
